intro: Malesherbia, commonly known as the "butterfly plant," is a genus of flowering plants in the family Malvaceae. These plants are native to South America and are characterized by their showy, butterfly-shaped flowers. The leaves are typically alternate and often have a velvety texture. Malesherbia species are often cultivated for their ornamental value due to their vibrant colors and unique floral structures. They thrive in well-drained soil and require full sun to partial shade for optimal growth.
